title: Value of a function based on its derivative

content.question: Let f be a differentiable function such that <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow> </math> for all x. Of the following, which is not a possible value for f (2)?

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
